sentence.Network_en: He was witty, amusing and gifted with a sharp business brain.

sentence.Network_en: Even the most gifted can have confidence destroyed by the wrong instructor.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使是最有天赋的人也可能会被错误的导师摧毁自信。

sentence.Network_en: She was a gifted teacher who never talked down to her students.
sentence.Network_cn: 她天生就是当老师的料，从来不用居高临下的口气对学生说话。

entry.tran: 有天赋的；有天才的；有天资的
entry.def: Someone who is gifted has a natural ability to do something well.

example.ex: ...one of the most gifted players in the world...
example.tran: 世界上最有天赋的运动员之一

example.ex: He was witty, amusing and gifted with a sharp business brain.
example.tran: 他机智诙谐，具有敏锐的商业头脑。

entry.def: A gifted child is much more intelligent or talented than average.

example.tran: 国家培养天才儿童的方案

means.word_mean: 1. showing a natural aptitude for something

Sentence.sentence: It embraces district-sanctioned magnet schools, such as the Talented and Gifted School, with 198 students, and the Science and Engineering Magnet,with383,which share a building in Dallas, as well as the City Honors School in Buffalo, N.Y., which grew out of volunteerevening seminars for students.

There is, in our view, no real dispute here, we are all seeking the same thing, which is schools that better serve our children and our nation by encouraging students to tackle tough subjects under the guidance of gifted teachers.
And in fact our admiration for the comically gifted is relatively new and not very well-founded, says Rod Martin's a psychologist at the University of Western Ontario.

sentences.en: The gifted author wrote one smash after another.
sentences.cn: 这个天才的作家创作了一篇又一篇轰动一时的作品。
